cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west toward the south-central Texas coast, remaining on a track that keeps the center south of Matagorda Bay but within striking distance of the middle Texas coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast, likely between Port Mansfield and Baffin Bay

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward through Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible Tuesday, peaking during the morning and early afternoon near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Matagorda and Lavaca Bays, including Calhoun Port Authority docks.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 7 inch totals could produce flash/urban flooding in and around the port facility.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby barrier islands; minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
